a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

div.p: Educating our future, guided by our past.

h1.span: Statewide School Closure Through School Year End

div.p: As per State of Alaska Health Mandate 013 - K-12 Public and Private Schools released on April 20, 2020, the statewide school closure of all K-12 public and private schools is being extended from May 1, 2020 to the end of the 2019-2020 school year. Despite the need to extend school building closures, student learning will continue, per each school district's individual plan, to provide distance-delivered educational services to students.

As school districts contemplate how to properly celebrate this year's graduates, COVID-19 Health Mandate 011 - Social Distancing is still in effect, which prohibits gathering for events, such as graduation.

We are saddened that we will not be able to gather this school year in a traditional manner for graduation, but want you to know that we are looking at options for celebrating our graduates and their accomplishments. We will have more information on plans for celebrating our senior class available in the coming days.

We will also be contining our meal service and current educational activities for students through our normal end of school year in May. As always, staff remains dedicated to our focus on student safety and learning.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Statewide School Closure Through School Year End

div.p: As per the memorandum from Commissioner Johnson to public schools on March 20, 2020.

Pursuant to the Declaration of Public Health Disaster Emergency issued by Governor Mike Dunleavy on March 11, 2020, and Alaska Statutes 26.23.020(g)(1) and (7), the Governor is suspending the regulatory requirement that school districts apply to the Commissioner for approval to substitute emergency closure days or up to ten in-service training days for days in session under AS 14.03.030 and 4 AAC 05.090(h). All other requirements of 4 AAC 05.090 are suspended. This suspension applies to any school closure during the period of March 20, 2020 through May 1, 2020.

p.a: Governor's Memo on Statewide School Closure Preapproval

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Statewide School Closure Preapproval

div.p: Per the Governor's public 11th health mandate on 27 March 2020, statewide social distancing will go into effect on March 28th, 2020 at 5:00 pm.

The purpose of this mandate is to restrict the movement of individuals within the State
of Alaska in order to prevent, slow, and otherwise disrupt the spread of the virus that
causes COVID-19.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for AK Health Mandate 011 - Social Distancing

div.p: The Alaska Department of Education and Early Development has announced that the Performance Evaluation for Alaska Schools (PEAKS), the Alaska Science Assessment, the alternate assessment, and WIDA ACCESS for ELLs have been cancelled. The U.S. Department of Education has reviewed a request to waive certain requirements of the assessment and accountability system, and is in the process of issuing a formal approval.

p.a: EED Press Release cancelling PEAKS testing

a.aria-label: Go to comments for PEAKS and WIDA Testing cancelled

h1.span: AK Governor extends school building closure through May 1, 2020

div.p: The Governor has extended the closure of school buildings until May 1, 2020. Students will receive instruction through distance delivery methods.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for AK Governor extends school building closure through May 1, 2020

h1.span: School building access limited until May 1, 2020

div.p: By order of the Governor, all public and private schools have been closed to students through May 1st, 2020 and students will receive instruction through distance delivery methods. In addition, Southwest Region School District has taken additional steps to reduce the number of school staff who are working in our buildings.

p.a: Governor's Memo Closing Schools to students through May 1st, 2020.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for School building access limited until May 1, 2020

div.div: Posted by Steve Noonkesser on 3/18/2020 4:00:00 PM

div.p: In an effort to keep you all informed of our work to help stem the spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19), we will be posting updates here as we release them. The situation is changing rapidly and we are responding to updates from health and government officials, as well as preparing for providing both school meals and instruction to students at home. (to view the update message to staff, please click on the image below)

a.aria-label: Go to comments for SWRS Coronavirus (COVID-19) Update

div.p: Per the Governor's public health mandate on 13 March 2020, visitiation has been suspended at:
and visition has been limited at:
In addition schools are being closed to students from March 16th through March 27th.
On March 16th, 2020 the governor has also closed to the public, from March 17, 2020 through March 31, 2020:
Staff in state-operated libraries, archives, and museums will continue to serve the public through telephone, web, and other modes.
In addition, the governor has ordered that residential school programs return students to their families and home communities by March 27th, 2020.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for AK Governor closes public facilities

h1.span: AK Governor closes schools until March 30th

div.p: In response to the growing threat from the novel coronavirus that causes COVID-19, Alaska Governor, Mike Dunleavy, has ordered visitiation suspended at:
and visition has been limited at:
In addition schools are being closed to students from March 16th through March 27th.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for AK Governor closes schools until March 30th

h1.span: School Closed from March 16, 2020 through March 27, 2020 by order of Governor Dunleavy

div.p: In order to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus that causes COVID-19, the Governor, Mike Dunleavy, has ordered all Alaskan schools to be closed from March 16th through March 27th, 2020. Teachers and staff will be using this time to prepare educational plans for remote delivery of instruction should the need arise.

p.a: Department of Education and Early Development memo closing schools from March 16th through 27th.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for School Closed from March 16, 2020 through March 27, 2020 by order of Governor Dunleavy
